snippet: As tourism to the region drops, cruise lines are cutting prices, and safety standards are falling, experts say.
abstract: Experts say tourism on Chinese river cruise lines is stagnant, with dropping fares leading to neglected safety inspections and inexperienced crews; capsizing of Yangtze River cruise ship on June 1 is leading to calls for improved shipping safety in East Asia.

byline.original: By IAN JOHNSON and KEITH BRADSHER
byline.contributor: Ian Johnson reported from Beijing, and Keith Bradsher from Hong Kong. Adam Wu and Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: As tourism to the region drops, cruise lines are cutting prices, and safety standards are falling, experts say.

headline.main: Oriental Star Accident Highlights Increase in Safety Problems on Yangtze Cruises
headline.print_headline: Recent Inspections Found an Increase in Safety Problems on Yangtze Cruise Boats
